intro: Actinodaphne scleroptera, commonly known as the rough-leafed camphor tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by dark, fleshy berries. Its bark and leaves contain essential oils, which have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. Actinodaphne scleroptera thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
